title: Kurnool Ultra Mega Solar Park, Andhra Pradesh
description: The Kurnool Solar Park was set up by Andhra Pradesh Solar Power Corporation through a joint venture special purpose vehicle, in which Solar Energy Corporation of India has 50% stake, Andhra Pradesh Generation Corporation (41%) and New and Renewable Energy Development Corporation (9%).

title: Pavagada Solar Park Shakti Sthala, Bangalore
description: The Pavagada Solar Park, situated in Karnataka, South India, stands as one of the largest solar parks in the world, symbolizing the countryâ€™s ambitious renewable energy goals. This massive solar facility was inaugurated in 2019, with a capacity of 2,050 megawatts spread across five villages in the Pavagada taluka of Tumkur district.

title: Green Hydrogen Plant, Bihar
description: Ashoka Buildcon plans to invest Rs 90 billion in establishing a green hydrogen plant in Bihar. The company signed a memorandum of understanding with the Bihar government, committing to the development of the project.

title: Mudasarlova Reservoir, Vishakhapatnam
description: The Mudasarlova Reservoir is one of the oldest man-made water bodies in Andhra Pradesh. It provides drinking water to Visakhapatnam households and is also a popular picnic spot. The floating solar power plant project was the first of its kind in Andhra Pradesh. The GVMC also has a 3 MW floating solar plant on the Meghadrigedda Reservoir in Visakhapatnam.
